Title: Object: Hebrew Women reading the Scriptures at Jerusalem
Series: Sir David Wilkie's Sketches in Turkey, Syria & Egypt, 1840 & 1841
Description: Women in oriental dress, one to left, breast-feeding and leaning to right to read from a book held by a younger woman sitting beside her, a child on the ground at their feet, leaning against her knees, while a third, older woman, sitting behind the first, turns her head towards them. 1844 Lithograph printed in grey and beige
Curator's comments: Specimen print for 'Sir David Wilkie's Sketches in Turkey, Syria & Egypt, 1840 & 1841', a set of lithographs 'Drawn on Stone by Joseph Nash', published in two volumes, London, 1843 and 1846. For more of the set, see 1918,0205.2-8.
Bibliographic references: Abbey Travel / Travel in Aquatint and lithography 1770-1860 from the library of J.R.Abbey (391.26)
Associated names: Associated with: Art Union of London
